official-title.#text:
Expressing support for dancing as a form of valuable exercise and artistic expression, and for the
			 designation of July 26, 2014, as National Dance Day.

sponsor.#tail: submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text:
supports the designation of National Dance Day to celebrate and encourage the national commitment
			 to dance education and physical fitness;

acknowledges that dance is making an important contribution to health by encouraging physical
			 fitness and reducing overweight and obesity; and
commends Nigel Lythgoe for his leadership in promoting National Dance Day.

quote.#tail:
, in association with the Dizzy Feet
			 Foundation, has encouraged the creation of National Dance Day in nations
			 around the world, beginning with the first National Dance Day on the
			 National Mall in 2010;
quote.#text: So You Think You Can Dance

text.#text: Whereas Nigel Lythgoe, executive producer and celebrity judge for the dance-themed television show

Whereas National Dance Day encourages many forms of dance expression, representing the Nation’s
			 rich artistic, regional, ethnic, and racial diversity;

Whereas National Dance Day features the spectrum of dance, from classical to popular to line and
			 partner dances;

Whereas dancing helps improve heart health, burn calories, strengthen muscles, and improve
			 flexibility for people of all ages;

Whereas health officials have repeatedly documented an overweight and obesity epidemic among every
			 age group in the United States;
Whereas dancing, in all its variations, is a popular form of physical exercise;

Whereas National Dance Day in the Nation’s Capital will begin at 1 p.m. with performances by Dizzy
			 Feet and other local talent; and

Whereas the last Saturday in July continues to be an appropriate day to celebrate National Dance
			 Day as it has been for the past 3 years: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 667 IH: Expressing support for dancing as a form of valuable exercise and artistic expression, and for the designation of July 26, 2014, as National Dance Day.
